Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2010 05:59PM NaughtybyNature wrote: Hi Louise: without even thinking twice a SECOND Opinion....  And remember... I am not saying that this doctor does not know what he is talking about... you better be on the safe side rather than sorry. Make sure you find a Dr. that you are happy with b/c there are plenty of "shoe-makers" out there!  He/she is to explain in detail the pros and cons and you are to go with your gut feeling.  This is your breast, not theirs... this is possibly the rest of your life... not theirs, this is your family history... not theirs. What ever you decide... my thoughts will be with you and may all be happy sunshine for you.

Posts.Title: ADH on core biopsy - what to expect from surgical biopsy? lana99 leaf

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2010 01:22PM NaughtybyNature wrote: Lana: do you have "the two plans" made?  One in case the news are not so good and one for the good news? If you don't... make them... try to be as cold as you can be, even though this is regarding you, your body, your life, and make those two plans. Try to stay as calm and collected as you can, because whatever is... it is already!  There's nothing you can do to change that BUT there's plenty you can do about those "two plans". Do you get my idea?  It's a mental game that you have to play and let it go... right now it's on someone else's hand... you are not in control... whatever is destined to you, is in control. Start working on those two plans and let me know about them... that's what I did not even a month ago... for the bad news, I already had a haircut lined-up, new what to I should do upon bad news... (scream, vent, cry, laugh and be thankful that it's me again, not my daughter, mother or best friend...)....  Did I make any sense to you?

Posts.Title: 5 years this week. Carmelle sue_m

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 05:25PM NaughtybyNature wrote: Deb: my first chemo I told the nurse to put the freaking needle on my right arm, even thou that is the side that I had my lumpectomy.  "Oh no... b/c the doctors do not like to mess around w/ the sick side...".  "But, you w/ be able to put the needle in me better on the right side versus left, I know!" "Oh no...". Making a long story short... she poke me so many times (again, my very first chemo) that I started to faint, sweating like a maniac, and literally going down like a just shot bird!!!!!!!!!!!!!  My poor mom did not even know what to do w/ me besides laying me back and putting my feet up, fanning me, and running to get me a coke... She finally nailed it... but the next days I had a huge black and blue on my left hand... never again I saw that nurse for my treatments, and the remaining 3 chemos, I had a different nurse and the needle went in my right arm!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You did not over-react... WE KNOW OUR BODIES almost better than some nurses/doctors.  I have another nurse story... but I w/ leave for some other time... ((((((((((((((((((((Hugs)))))))))))))))))))))

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2008 12:37PM NaughtybyNature wrote: Kari Lynn: I know you cannot read this, but may be "mom" can read it to you and squeeze your hand for me, just like this morning... the following are not my words, as I have none right now but an infinite ocean of tears... therefore, this is what I found subtle for now:  "This note is for someone who's always there for me. This note is for someone who is tough, honest and true. This note is for someone who is amazing and exceptional. This note is for someone who always pulls through. This note is for someone who is special and rare. This note is for someone who cannot be compared to. This note is for someone who is irreplaceable in my life. This note is for you, "Xena", my Princess Warrior!" **** Kari Lynn and family, "My life has taught me that you can't control what life dishes out. You can only choose how you deal with it and who stands up with you. Adele Frances (adapted) When I say that I am here for you, I mean that you have my complete support. That I am here - to listen, to talk, to stand beside you - to do whatever it is you need me to do and to be wherever it is you need me to be. I'm here for you because you are my friend and this is where I want to be." Always,
